sentences: One night, while out on the town with friends, a singer at a popular club gave her the microphone and Zoi started to sing.
section: == Biography == | === Early life ===

sentences: Zoi performed the duet "Maskes" with famed singer Peggy Zina at the club in her last year while living in Thessaloniki and soon left for Athens to further her career.
section: == Biography == | === Early life ===

sentences: 2003: Beginnings and To Proto Vima
section: == Biography == | === 2003: Beginnings and To Proto Vima ===

sentences: In Athens, her first year of singing in the Athenian music clubs was with Peggy Zina.
section: == Biography == | === 2003: Beginnings and To Proto Vima ===

sentences: Soon after, she got a record contract with Minos EMI and released her debut album To Proto Vima (The First Step) in June 2003.
section: == Biography == | === 2003: Beginnings and To Proto Vima ===

sentences: In the summer of 2004, she started appearances at popular club "Thalassa" with Elena Paparizou, Thanos Petrelis, and Nino where she further showcased her vocal abilities.

section: == Biography == | === 2006–present: Th' Afisei Epohi and Me To Heri Stin Kardia ===

sentences: On May 5, 2006, Apostolia Zoi released her third studio album titled "Th' Afisei Epohi" (It will leave a history) featuring fifteen new songs.
section: == Biography == | === 2006–present: Th' Afisei Epohi and Me To Heri Stin Kardia ===

sentences: In June 2007, Zoi sang a duet remix with the famous Kostas Tournas of "Geia Sou" at the "Mad Music Video Awards".
